item.title: My First Post
item.description: here's some content. let's do this thing! testing live updating:

item.title: My Favorite Movies of 2019
item.description: Out of 74 movies, I wanted to pick a few that really stood out, and then talk briefly about a few that I really didn't enjoy. I went to the theater quite a bit this year, as I live pretty close to one with couch-seats and luckily have a few film-buddies to meet up with. Other films that I didn't get a chance to see while they were on the big screen were rented at home or watched through a myriad of streaming services I've accrued over the years.
brook is a noted sapphist who lives in a forest with her cat snorri. she loves travel, food, and satan.

movie list years: 2016 2017 2018 2019 2019 74 Movies Ford vs. Ferrari A blast! I love car racing so much, and this film was a gorgeous vision of a famous showdown between an incredible car company, and Ford. I grew up hearing stories about Shelby, and this film brought him to life. Uncut Gems This was wild! From front to back this movie was a rollercoaster of poor decision-making and the world of vigs, 3 way parlay, and Kevin Garnet.

item.title: book list
item.description: years: 2016 2017 2018 2019 2019 56 books Dept. of Speculation — Jenny Offill A gorgeous and sad book that captures long relationships so well. I loved for narrator and the strange poetic style of storytelling. I read this in two sittings and was enraptured. Dead Astronauts — Jeff Vandermeer This book did some interesting things with time, and some deeply annoying things with text. I feel like I know what he was doing with this book largely, and support his environmental aims (a+ murderous blue fox), but it never really came together for me.
